strapiGuide.title: 10 Unique Airbnbs in Northwest Arkansas
strapiGuide.description:
If you're looking for somewhere to stay in Northwest Arkansas, you've come to the right place. This guide has something for everyone, from funky A-frames to luxury tree houses. 

These short-term rental options highlight Northwest Arkansas's most unique places. Enjoy!
strapiGuide.content:
If you're looking for somewhere to stay in Northwest Arkansas, you've come to the right place. This guide has something for everyone, from funky A-frames to luxury tree houses. 

These short-term rental options highlight Northwest Arkansas's most unique places. Enjoy!


The Hideout Airstream 

Fayetteville Mill District

Photos courtesy of thehideout_airstreamcamping 

Who needs a house when you can stay in an Airstream? The Hideout Airstream rental in the Fayetteville Mill district has everything you need for a little escape. With a modern camping twist, you can walk to coffee shops, restaurants, and a neighborhood pub all from your Airstream. Hop on the Razorback Greenway for an evening stroll through Fayetteville's Lower Ramble, and come back in time to enjoy a fire on the lawn.

View the Hideout Airstream listing on Airbnb HERE.


Treehouse @ Whitetail & Pine

Fayetteville

Photos courtesy of Airbnb

Located in the treetops of Fayetteville, this unique home is tucked away on 13 acres of land and sits 25 ft above Goose Creek. This treehouse is crafted almost entirely from western red cedar, including the wood-fired cedar hot tub on the wrap-around porch. With sliding glass doors that open to merge the inside of the home with nature, to a hammock net inside the floor of the master bedroom, this house has everything you didn't realize you needed. Also, it is only a 15-minute drive to the Fayetteville Square, so you can escape reality without being too far from town.

View the Treehouse @ the Whitetail & Pine listing on Airbnb HERE.


The Ozark Adobe

Downtown Bentonville

Photos courtesy of Airbnb

The Ozark Adobe is situated in Downtown Bentonville, minutes from the Bentonville Square and Crystal Bridges Museum of American Arts. With access to Slaughter Pen trail and an under five-minute bike ride to the Downtown square, this place is perfect for the modern biking enthusiast. Modeled after the adobe homes in the southwest, this place vibes unlike any other house in Northwest Arkansas.

View the Ozark Adobe listing on Airbnb HERE.


Lakeview Haven

Springdale, Beaver Lake

Photos courtesy of mysticozarkadventures

This A-Frame home overlooks Beaver Lake and War Eagle Cove, offering year-long water views with its unique floor-to-ceiling windows. With a short walk to the water, this home has access to a beach where you can launch kayaks and paddleboards while still being accessible to the surrounding towns of Springdale, Fayetteville, and Rogers. With an outdoor patio fire pit and lounge chairs overlooking the water, this treehouse A-frame is the perfect place to enjoy the views Northwest Arkansas has to offer.

Natalie and Mark at Mystic Ozark Adventures also were one of the winners of the Airbnb OMG fund and are building a Planetarium Treehouse next to Lakeview Haven. It is scheduled to open in August. Find updates and pictures of the amazing design on their Instagram.

View the Lakeview Haven listing on Airbnb HERE.


Freckled Hen Cottage

Fayetteville

Photos courtesy of Freckled Hen Cottage

This charming 1920s cottage sits in the heart of Fayetteville. With a sunroom overlooking the wooded backyard, and a clawfoot tub in the farmhouse bathroom, you can enjoy all the relaxation of a little cabin in the woods. The Freckled Hen Cottage also has a selection of add-ons to include in your stay to make it even more memorable. Get a seasonal bouquet from Meus Floral to welcome you home, a fully set up projector in the backyard, or a Bee's Knees Cocktail Kit made by Pink House Alchemy. If you want a stay that highlights all things Fayetteville, the Freckled Hen Cottage is the perfect spot.

View the Freckled Hen Cottage listing on Airbnb HERE.


Local @ Coler

Bentonville

Photos courtesy of Airbnb

This 6-unit condo in Bentonville is fully decked out with artwork by local artist Sasha Rayevskiy. With an outdoor bar and patio, a speakeasy you can rent out upon booking, and multiple rooms for rent, you can have some personal time away with family or rent the place out for a large gathering. Only .5 miles from Coler Mountain Bike Preserve, this place is perfect for visiting bikers or those wanting to explore Bentonville's renowned trails. With a bike wash station and storage included, this place makes it easy to pack up and come see what Bentonville is all about. Local @ Coler Vacation Homes is managed by Stay NWA. Check out their other unique listings on their Instagram.

View the Local @ Coler listing on Airbnb HERE.


A on D

Downtown Bentonville

Photos courtesy of Justin Palmer

This modern A-frame on D Street in Downtown Bentonville is just .5 miles from Crystal Bridges and the Square. Crack open a complimentary local beer and enjoy the elegant patio outside the floor-to-ceiling windows. Minutes from the Razorback Greenway, you can walk around Bentonville and end the night in the fully decked-out movie room on the lower level of the house.

View the A on D listing on Airbnb HERE.


The Magruder

Fayetteville

Photos courtesy of Airbnb

The Magruder, designed by local architect Cyrus Sutherland is a perfect stay for those who enjoy architecture history. Part of the National Historic Registry, this home has mid-century modern written all over it. Natural stone and wood throughout this home accentuate the wooded landscape. Only .7 miles from Donald W. Reynolds Stadium, the Magruder sits near the heart of the University of Arkansas but feels like a cabin getaway.

View the Magruder listing on Airbnb HERE.


The Treehouse

Bentonville

Photos courtesy of Airbnb

This Bentonville tree house has the perfect space for hosting a crowd. With a ground space opening up to the outdoor patio and pool, a main treehouse, and an open-air living room, this multi-building home holds two kitchens and living rooms. Open up the glass garage doors and walk out on the swinging bridge to hammock above the trees, or relax in the pool surrounded by your friends and family. This home is a great place to explore Bentonville and can connect your group while allowing for plenty of space to co-exist.

View The Treehouse listing on Airbnb HERE.


Cypress Getaway

Rogers

Photos courtesy of Airbnb

Just 2 minutes from Beaver Lake dock access, this cute A-Frame home is a great getaway for lake enthusiasts. With outdoor patios, a fire pit, and a hot tub, this is the perfect home to stay in any season to enjoy the nature of Northwest Arkansas. With a less than 15-minute drive to Downtown Rogers, you can get the best of the city while ending the night at the perfect lake cabin.

View the Cypress Getaway listing on Airbnb HERE.
